TopicTitle: The hardest thing in KSP for me is....

Articles.Content: Designing craft that combine aesthetics and function.

Designing elegantly minimalist craft. Feature Creep thinks he's my friend, he's always hanging with me, getting me into trouble, etc. My first mission to Jool started as a single unmanned craft that would drop six probe craft, one for each moon and one for Jool itself. It ended with a 300+ ton mothership with a crew of 12, kethane refining abilities, two landers, greenhouses for life support, etc. Yeah, sometimes Feature Creep is nice to hang with, but not all the time.
Finishing projects. My save files are littered with incompleted stations and bases.
The hardest thing for me is getting an efficient intercept, I always feel like I'm using far more fuel than should be necessary.
Taking off without crashing.
Returning to the VAB/SPH without having to restart the game
All the work to upload crafts, pics and provide info on the company blog, then provide links for all of them
Landing accurately and precisely on planets with atmospheres. UGH.
Finding something interesting to do...
To use it for less time than I had planned....
getting the game to launch in the first place. (see below)
Spaceplanes definitely.
For me I would say that Rendezvous and docking is extremely difficult for me, but It really understanding orbital mechanics such as Delta-V and wrapping my mind around the physical laws of KSP
The hardest thing to do in KSP for me is stop playing and shut the game down.
nice to see everyone contributing to this thread
Getting to Eeloo.

I started off making rockets but I finally dove into making spaceplanes(they are the reason I really bought ksp) and I absolutely love them. I hate to brag but my most recent design put 43 tons into 160km LKO. It was a full orange tank plus essentials to dock with my station. If any of you guys having trouble with spaceplanes shoot me a message I'd be happy to help out! I won't lie though I use mods for a bit of help, aesthetically and functionally. I don't know what I would do without b9 or Pwings..

To be on topic it would probably be to stop messing around on kerbin and launch my first interplanetary mission that I've been planning. Unfortunately I feel the need to test everything just right which is okay I guess. I haven't even attempted an interplanetary transfer yet but I'm just going to go for it. I just hope my ssto is up for the flight and that will be my biggest challenge for now ^^

Edit: Grammar :S

Edited October 7, 2013 by How2FoldSoup
.... getting everyone in the room to shut up so I can play in peace

Hardest thing for me in KSP:

not over compensating on EVERYTHING when building a new vehicle
Building an SSTO. I can have a 2kt interplanetary ship but getting one little spaceplane into LKO is something I simply seem incapable of doing.
building ships in orbit, i've got docking pretty well now but i can't seem to be able to make a decent ship in orbit to go and return from Duna
Finding the time to play it when university assignments are pending.

Rendezvous, definitely.

I have a very hard time getting two craft to meet up in orbit without a lot of futzing around... though I have to say the maneuver nodes made it a bit easier. I've been tempted on several occasions to get the MechJeb mod just for this alone... but I really dislike the thought of altering the game from it's vanilla state. I'll just keep practicing until I get it right.

Edited October 7, 2013 by Kryssandra
Having the discipline not to play it when university assignments are pending.

^^

On a similar note;

knowing when to go to bed when one has to get up for work in 5 hours time but these new mods are so nice and fun and pretty lights and cargo bay doors and pistons and rotating discs and...and...and....

ZZzzzZZZZzzzzzzzzZZZZZZZZZzzzzzzzzzzzZZZZZZzzzzzzzz

*Sacked*
